caption_original:
We ensure employees of your airline receive appropriate accessibility training to carry out their functions, as per the "Personnel Training for the Assistance of Persons with Disabilities Regulations".

We also regularly visit air carriers and airports to verify that they comply with accessibility related requirements. 

To report an accessibility issue in an airport, contact an enforcement officer: http://ow.ly/KDao30aDpL8.

caption_original:
The Agency's enforcement powers are set out in legislation and regulation. These enforcement powers include:

• ensuring the aircraft are insured and authorized under licence by Transport Canada,
• verification of flight records, tickets, invoices and other financial records,
• reviewing airline tariffs to ensure they comply with the licence and the law,
• ensure that companies have training programs in place to train employees to help persons with disabilities,
• ensure that advertisers of air fares comply with all-inclusive air price advertising regulations.

For more information about the scope and limits to our enforcement activities, see http://ow.ly/NaYZ30ejT8b

caption_original:
Consumer protection for air travel

One of the CTA's mandates is consumer protection for air travellers. This means that you can turn to us if you believe an airline hasn't respected its terms and conditions of service or you think those terms and conditions are unreasonable.

https://youtu.be/8bYMrAMs7j0

caption_original:
When a coasting trade licence application is needed to transport passengers, we must determine if a Canadian-registered ship can provide an identical or similar adequate marine service.

To do this, we need complete, clear and pertinent information concerning the offered ship and the nature of the proposed activity.

To find out what kind of information you must provide in passenger service applications, see section 2.3 of our Guidelines at http://ow.ly/hRdD30aDDqn

#TravelTips > Have Insurance When You Travel

Include protection against baggage loss, delay, damage or theft, trip cancellation or interruption, personal injury or death, as well as sufficient medical coverage.

 #FlySmart > Top 10 Tips > http://ow.ly/uy2l3061cit

caption_original:
Air carriers are required to comply with the "Canada Transportation Act", the "Air Transportation Regulations" and the "Personnel Training for the Assistance of Persons with Disabilities Regulations".

Our job is to make sure that they do, so as to protect your air traveller rights.

Find out the total number of inspections carried out and contraventions applied by our enforcement officers: http://ow.ly/NJQ230dcbPa

caption_original:
#TravelTips > Be Sure to Have All of Your Travel Documents

It's your responsibility to have the proper travel documents to enter a foreign country and return to Canada. All Canadian travellers, including children, must have their own passport. Consult the diplomatic mission of each country you intend to visit for its entry requirements.

 #FlySmart > Top 10 Tips > http://ow.ly/uy2l3061cit

caption_original:
The Canadian Transportation Agency's story began 113 years ago.

Its first incarnation – the Board of Railway Commissioners – was established on a snowy day in February 1904 in Ottawa.

As Canada has evolved, our responsibilities and services evolved with it. 
Want to know more? Read At the Heart of Transportation: A Moving History >  http://ow.ly/IsZ530dbqS1

caption_original:
#TravelTips > Pack Smart

Include your contact information and your destination contact information inside each piece of baggage. Always carry essential and valuable items with you on board: your passport, identification and return tickets; medicines and medical devices; money, jewelry and electronic equipment; and, essential overnight items.

 #FlySmart > Top 10 Tips > http://ow.ly/uy2l3061cit
caption_cleaned: > Pack Smart Include your contact information and your destination contact information inside each piece of baggage. Always carry essential and valuable items with you on board: your passport, identification and return tickets; medicines and medical devices; money, jewelry and electronic equipment; and, essential overnight items. > Top Tips >

caption_original:
#TravelTips > Call Ahead

From carrying sports equipment and musical instruments, to dietary restrictions, medical conditions and disability-related needs, most carriers require from 48 to 72 hours notice to accommodate special requests.

 #FlySmart > Top 10 Tips > http://ow.ly/uy2l3061cit
caption_cleaned: > Call Ahead From carrying sports equipment and musical instruments, to dietary restrictions, medical conditions and disability-related needs, most carriers require from to hours notice to accommodate special requests. > Top Tips >

caption_original:
#TravelTips > Know Your Carrier's Limits

Each carrier sets out its own limits for carry-on and checked baggage. Carriers also set time limits for reporting and filing complaints about lost, damaged or delayed baggage. Check your carrier's tariff for its baggage rules and allowances.

 #FlySmart > Top 10 Tips > http://ow.ly/uy2l3061cit

Carriers also set time limits for reporting and filing complaints about lost, damaged or delayed baggage. Check your carrier's tariff for its baggage rules and allowances. > Top Tips >
